content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5)  
  • Neighbour entity: Burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)  
  • Neighbour entity: Assembling machine (for copper‐cable production) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Depot Belt System at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– Belt depot wooden chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter (placed with direction UP) at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5)  
  • Its pickup position serves as the final target for belt connection

### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
– When connecting transport belts, avoid targeting a steam engine object. Instead, add an inserter that feeds items into the intended target. This error recurred in Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, and 217.
– Ensure you are within the allowed placement range when positioning an entity. The wooden chest placement errors (e.g. at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)) indicate that being too far from the target prevents placement.
– Verify that all required inventory items are available before attempting placement. The error about “No wooden_chest in inventory” shows the need for prechecking inventory.
– Confirm that all variables are properly defined to avoid undefined name errors (e.g. the NameError for ‘target_chest’).
